    • Method Detail

      • dealPlayer

        public void dealPlayer(Player player,
                       int delay)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: GameEngine
         Deal cards to the player as follows.
 1. Deal a card to the player.
 2. Call GameEngineCallback.nextCard(Player, PlayingCard , GameEngine).
 3. Continue looping until the player busts (default value of GameEngine.BUST_LEVEL).
 4. Call GameEngineCallback.bustCard(Player, PlayingCard, GameEngine).
 5. Call GameEngineCallback.result(Player, int, GameEngine)
    with final result for player (the pre bust total).
 6. Update the player with final result so it can be retrieved later.
        Specified by:
        dealPlayer in interface GameEngine
        Parameters:
        player - the current player who will have their result set at the end of the hand
        delay - the delay between cards being dealt (in milliseconds (ms))
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown when delay param is < 0 or > 1000

      • dealHouse

        public void dealHouse(int delay)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: GameEngine
         Same as GameEngine.dealPlayer(Player, int) other than the two notes below but deals for the house and calls the
 house versions of the callback methods on GameEngineCallback, no player parameter is required.
 
 Note:
 1. At the end of the round but before calling calling GameEngineCallback.houseResult(int, GameEngine)
 this method should iterate all players and call GameEngine.applyWinLoss(Player, int) 
 to update each player's points.
 2. After calling GameEngineCallback.houseResult(int, GameEngine)
 this method should also call Player.resetBet() on each player in preparation for 
 the next round.
        Specified by:
        dealHouse in interface GameEngine
        Parameters:
        delay - the delay between cards being dealt (in milliseconds (ms))
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown when delay param is < 0

      • deal

        private int deal(Player player,
                 int delay)
         Utility method to deal cards for a single round regardless of player/house.
 Note:
 Only the GameEngine.dealHouse(int) is allowed to pass null as the player parameter
 to distinguish deal behavior for the house, since a player with null value is never added to the collection.
        Parameters:
        delay - - the delay in between dealing a card
        player - - the player object (player/house) the card is being dealt to
        Returns:
        the final score for this round

      • logPlayer

        private void logPlayer(Player player,
                       PlayingCard card,
                       int playerScore)
        Utility method to log the player's round events.
        Parameters:
        player - - the Player to whom the card is dealt
        card - - the dealt PlayingCard
        playerScore - - the score the player obtained from the round

      • logHouse

        private void logHouse(PlayingCard card,
                      int houseScore)
        House's version of the logger method to log the house's round events.
        Parameters:
        card - - the dealt PlayingCard
        houseScore - - the score the house obtained from the round

      • applyWinLoss

        public void applyWinLoss(Player player,
                         int houseResult)
        Description copied from interface: GameEngine
         A player's bet is settled by this method i.e. win or loss is applied to update betting points
 based on a comparison of the player result and the provided houseResult.
 Note:
 This method is usually called from GameEngine.dealHouse(int)
 as described above but is included in the public interface to facilitate testing.
        Specified by:
        applyWinLoss in interface GameEngine
        Parameters:
        player - the Player to apply win/loss to
        houseResult - contains the calculated house result

      • addPlayer

        public void addPlayer(Player player)
        Description copied from interface: GameEngine
        Note: Player id is unique and if another player with same id is added it replaces the previous player.
        Specified by:
        addPlayer in interface GameEngine
        Parameters:

      • placeBet

        public boolean placeBet(Player player,
                        int bet)
        Description copied from interface: GameEngine
        The implementation forwards the call to the player class so the bet is set per player.
        Specified by:
        placeBet in interface GameEngine
        Parameters:
        player - the player who is placing the bet
        bet - the bet in points
        Returns:
        true if the player had sufficient points and the bet was valid and placed
        See Also:
        Player.setBet(int)

      • addGameEngineCallback

        public void addGameEngineCallback(GameEngineCallback gameEngineCallback)
        Description copied from interface: GameEngine
         Method to add a client specific implementation of GameEngineCallback used to perform display updates etc.
 Callbacks are called in the order they were added.
 Note: Used different implementation of the callback for the console and GUI versions.
        Specified by:
        addGameEngineCallback in interface GameEngine
        Parameters:
        gameEngineCallback - the callback object

      • removeGameEngineCallback

        Method to remove an implementation of GameEngineCallback.
        Specified by:
        removeGameEngineCallback in interface GameEngine
        Parameters:
        gameEngineCallback - instance to be removed if no longer needed
        Returns:
        true if the gameEngineCallback existed

      • getShuffledHalfDeck

        public java.util.Deque<PlayingCard> getShuffledHalfDeck()
        Description copied from interface: GameEngine
        A debug method to return a "half" deck of cards containing 28 unique cards (8 through to Ace) in
        random/shuffled order (i.e. should return a new deck that is random WRT previous one).
        Specified by:
        getShuffledHalfDeck in interface GameEngine
        Returns:
        a Deque (specific type of collection) of PlayingCard
